page.title: 03MEMORIAL HALL.
page.content: The Memorial Hall was built to remember the people killed in the 2nd World War. When you are going towards Truro it is on your right just before the crossroads. It is built back off the road with a car park holding 20 cars. It is now built of concrete walls and the roof is of tiles, being rebuilt a few years ago. The caretaker is Mrs Waters who cleans it and keeps the keys.There are six rooms in the building, the main hall, the boys toilet,the girls toilet, the back stage room, the snack bar room, while out side there is a room in which they keep the food. They have Keep Fit there every Thursday and discos once a month which start at 7.00 and finish at 11.30. They also have birthday parties and wedding receptions as well as youth club meetings.
